Hello Nanci, Thank you for taking the time to provide us with feedback. We are glad one of our team members, Michelle, was able to reach you and offer assistance. We like to make sure we’re providing the best experience possible and the resources you need. If you have any additional questions or concerns, you can contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.

Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We are here to help. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds. We are glad one of our team members, Michelle, was able to reach you and offer assistance. We like to make sure we are providing the best experience possible and the resources you need. If you have any additional questions or concerns, you can contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.
Thank you for your kind words!

Hello, We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with feedback.When your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. If you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over, it moves into an IRA. The individual is then responsible for the maintenance of the account. The fees associated with your account can be found in the welcome letter you received or accessed through your online account at https://secure.mtrustcompany.com. One of our team members, Michelle, attempted to reach you on October 14th and left a voice message. If you would like to discuss this issue or have additional questions, we encourage you to contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.
We aim to please!  Thank you for the feedback!

Hello Aaron, Thank you for your feedback. One of our team members, Tim, attempted to reached you on October 14th, but was not able to leave a message. If you would like to discuss this issue or have additional questions, we encourage you to contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.Please note:  depending on the type of account you are holding you have a few options : -Keep your account with Millennium Trust Company. -Rollover the Traditional IRA to your Employer Plan (not a Roth IRA option). -Transfer the account to a different IRA custodian. -Take a distribution by cashing out the account. IRS taxes and penalties may apply.

Hello Derik, We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with feedback.When your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. If you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over, it moves into an IRA. The individual is then responsible for the maintenance of the account. The fees associated with your account can be found in the welcome letter you received or accessed through your online account at https://secure.mtrustcompany.com. We are glad one of our team members, Pauline, was able to reach you and offer assistance. We like to make sure we’re providing the best experience possible and the resources you need. Hello, I’m here to help. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds. Our records show that your transaction request was completed on October 3rd and the account is now closed. If there is anything else we can help you with, please don't hesitate to call. We are more than happy to assist. You can contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.

Hello Guillermo,  Thank you for your feedback. When your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. If you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over, it moves into an IRA. The individual is then responsible for the maintenance of the account. The fees associated with your account can be found in the welcome letter you received or accessed through your online account at https://secure.mtrustcompany.com.

Hello Moyain, We apologize for the experience you had. We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with feedback.When your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. If you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over, it moves into an IRA. The individual is then responsible for the maintenance of the account. The fees associated with your account can be found in the welcome letter you received or accessed through your online account at https://secure.mtrustcompany.com. Hi Brent, We apologize for the frustrating experience you had, but appreciate you taking the time to provide us with feedback. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds. The fees associated with your account can be found in the welcome letter you received or accessed through your online account at https://secure.mtrustcompany.com. One of our team members, Terri, reached out to you on July 5th to discuss this matter. We like to make sure we’re providing the best experience possible and the resources you need. Hi Wendi, There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds.  One of our team members, Gwyn, attempted to reach you on June 30th and left a voicemail. If you would like to discuss your account or any other concerns, we encourage you to contact us at at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.
Thank you!

Hi Maria, When your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. If you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over, it moves into an IRA. The individual is then responsible for the maintenance of the account. The fees associated with your account can be found in the welcome letter you received or accessed through your online account at https://secure.mtrustcompany.com. One of our team members, Gwyn, attempted to reach you on June 28th and left a voicemail. We like to make sure we’re providing the best experience possible and the resources you need. If you would like to discuss your account’s fee structure or any other concerns, you can contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.

Hi Richard, Thank you for your feedback. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds. Additionally, when the account gets rolled over and moves into an IRA, the individual is then responsible for the maintenance of the account. The fees associated with your account can be found in the welcome letter you received or accessed through your online account at https://secure.mtrustcompany.com. One of our team members, Terri, attempted to reach you on June 6th to discuss this issue, and left you a voice message. If you would like to discuss your account's fee structure or any other concerns, we encourage you to contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.

Hi Adam, We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with feedback. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Hello, There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds.  Additionally, when your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. If you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. The individual is then responsible for the maintenance of the account after the funds are rolled over to an IRA. The fees associated with your account can be found in the welcome letter you received or accessed through your online account at https://secure.mtrustcompany.com.We are glad one of our team members, Yesenia, was able to reach you and discuss your account. If you have additional questions or concerns, you can contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.

Hi John, There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds.  The fees associated with your account can be found in the welcome letter you received or accessed through your online account at https://secure.mtrustcompany.com.One of our team members, Terri, attempted to reach you May 3rd and left a voicemail. Hi Maryjane, When your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. If you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over, it moves into an IRA. The individual is then responsible for the maintenance of the account. The fees associated with your account can be found in the welcome letter you received or accessed through your online account at https://secure.mtrustcompany.com.One of our team members, Terri, attempted to reach you April 29th and left a voicemail. Hi Sarah,There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds.  One of our supervisors, Frank, sent you an email if you would like to discuss the automatic rollover process further. We like to make sure we’re providing the best experience possible and the resources you need. If you have any other questions or concerns, you can contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.

Hello Edward,There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. Hi Katheryn, we apologize for the experience you had, but appreciate you taking the time to provide us with feedback. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Additionally, when your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. When you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over and it moves into an IRA, it’s the individual who is responsible for the maintenance of the account.  One of our supervisors, Frank, left you a voicemail last week with his direct contact information if you want to reach out and discuss the account and fees further. You can also contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CT or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.
Thank you for your kind words!

Paul, I’m here to help. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. when your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. When you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over and it moves into an IRA, it’s the individual who is responsible for the maintenance of the account.

Hi Theresa, we apologize for the frustrating experience you had! I see a representative attempted to reach you by phone yesterday to discuss the situation further. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, or because of a terminated plan. If any contact information provided by the former employer plan is outdated or incorrect at the time of the rollover, it may have been more difficult for Millennium Trust to reach you. If you would like a more detailed explanation of your account details, we encourage you to contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-8PM CST or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.
We are thrilled you had a great experience with us!

You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. When your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. When you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over and it moves into an IRA, it’s the individual who is responsible for the maintenance of the account.

Hello, I’m here to help. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds. If you have any additional questions, please contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-6PM CST or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.

Hello, I’m here to help. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds.

Hello, when your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. When you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over and it moves into an IRA, it’s the individual who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. But if you would like to further discuss fees on your account, Please contact us so we can discuss in detail. You can also contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-6PM CST or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.

Hello when your funds were being held in a sponsored retirement plan, it’s the plan who is responsible for the maintenance of the account. When you no longer work for the company or if your plan was terminated, they are unable to continue to provide you with that benefit. When the account gets rolled over and it moves into an IRA, it’s the individual who is responsible for the maintenance of the account.  If you have any questions regarding the fees please contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-6PM CST or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.

Hello, I’m here to help. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds.  We tried to call and was able to leave a message.  Please contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-6PM CST if you have any additional questions.

James, I’m here to help. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds. I have sent you a private message to further discuss your account.

Nicholas, I’m here to help. There are a few reasons your account may have been transferred to Millennium Trust. You previously contributed assets to your former employer’s retirement plan program. However, there was no instruction for where to direct upon your departure. Per government regulations, your existing retirement plan assets were rolled into an independent retirement account (IRA) with Millennium Trust. Reasons the funds were automatically rolled over could include plan balance below $5,000, an outdated address on record, an uncashed check, or because of a terminated plan. Our goal is to reconnect you with your retirement funds. We tried calling and was able to leave a message.  Please contact us at 877-682-4727 Monday through Friday from 7AM-6PM CST or online at www.mtrustcompany.com/support.

We appreciate you taking the time to leave us a review. When a retirement plan decides to roll over funds for missing or non-responsive participants into an automatic rollover IRA, the plan is required to choose an initial investment designed to preserve principal and provide a rate of return consistent with liquidity. The fee structure is set by your prior custodian. At Millennium Trust, we pride ourselves in our ability to reunite individuals with their retirement funds and to empower them to then self-direct their own investments and transactions. We have a robust investment portal that clients can use to make their own investment decisions. Frank, one of our Client Servicing Supervisors will be reaching out today to discuss your account in more detail.

Thank you for sharing your feedback. When it comes to alternative investments, we are bound by the rules set forth by the alternative investment when it comes to liquidations. Everything was moved into your account back in September and we did request a liquidation of the security at that time. Many alternative investments are considered illiquid which means that the holder either has to wait for the investment to liquidate, or they must find a 3rd party buyer to buy the investment from them. I would recommend contacting the investment sponsor to see if there is any way they can make an exception for you or look to see if you can find a buyer to buy this investment from you. I will have someone reach out to you regarding the fees on the account.
